intro: Cupania praealta, commonly known as the tall cupania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered greenish-yellow flowers, which are followed by distinctive three-lobed fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
